WRITING.TITLE: When the guy who subtitled Backstroke of the West gets into merchandising

WRITING.TEXT: Lightsaber*
Damn that's a high quality tusken mask, where's it from?

Lmao I don't wanna attack the guy physically or verbally, it'll probably only make me look like a loose cannon or something.
Seriously though, I try and be as nice as I can but anytime I do he doesn't seem to be in any way appreciative. I sorta get the impression that if I'm too nice to him he'll only end up being more disrespectful and get even worse, almost him thinking like he owns me or is better than me, if you catch my drift?

I know that some of my friends genuinely do like him and I think that some others aren't too fond of him but nothing really to my extent, I feel getting people on my side would only make a divide in the group so I obviously don't want that. Also I'd sorta feel bad for him getting him out of the group since he doesn't really have any other friends apart from us.

WRITING.TITLE: How to deal with a person I don't like in my group of friends?
WRITING.TEXT:
This guy has been gradually getting more grating over the past ~1 year and I know that he doesn't like me. I'm in the equivalent of high school and I only see him in school, he doesn't seem to hang around with any of my other friends outside of school. I'm willing to be civil with him and I don't escalate things but he's getting more confrontational (nothing serious) and this is getting on my nerves. He does things like say my name over and over and is just generally condescending not only to me but to other people as well.
How can I deal with this guy?
It'd be the same reaction as always
Nothing I guess, it'd just be more costly and you'd need more guards. Also Dany has lived basically all her life in Essos, most people even in Westeros think the NW is a relic of a bygone age.
The Watch still sent out Rangers though, they almost definitely would have seen. Then the NW could've temporarily used whatever castle the wildlings were at used the defenses against them.
Also, why does KL have a Lannister sigil? Joffrey is biologically a Lannister but his family name is Baratheon.
Being sent to The Wall is only a choice given to criminals in Westeros.
Lol it's not actually confirmed but it's confirmed in spirit.
I think I see what you're getting at, but wouldn't Ned have had uncles and cousins etc?

I'm having trouble getting my question across right, I'll try and word it as clearly as I can.
Throughout the series we see/hear of tons of people whose family name is Lannister (Lancel,Kevan,Martyn,Willem,Orson).
The relatives that we see of the Starks, for example, are mainly the Tullys. How come there is no mention of say, cousins of the Stark's who were born a Stark and didn't become the Stark's relatives through marriage.

No, I mean how come we see people like Lancel and Kevan Lannister who are extended family of Tywin,Jaime etc. but we never see any extended family of Baratheons or Starks(discounting the Tullys) for example.
